result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Rick A. Spencer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Rick A. Spencer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Rick A. Spencer was found guilty of Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).
  • Rick A. Spencer was found guilty of Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Prior: 2009 Beaver Lodge Road, Mercer, WI 54547 United States
DEJ

11:51 a.m. Defendant Rick A. Spencer in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Pfeifer/Burns statement to agreement. State moves to amend Counts 2 and 3  to Misdemeanor Failure to Support - Granted. State moves to dismiss Count 4 - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. DEJ filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty of Count 2 and 3; Court accepts plea on Count 1, defers entry of judgment and accepts written Deferred agreement. Pfeifer/Burns/Court statement on sentencing
Court Sentence - Counts 2 and 3 
WHS/POP - 2 years
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Pay all child support obligations.
Maintain employment
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.
NO review date for DEJ as DEJ is contingent upon Probation - DEJ will be dismiss/rescinded depending upon results of probation.
Adj. 12:03 p.m.
